img.alt: Baxter Academy for Technology and Science

div.p: In response to the outbreak of COVID-19, Baxter Academy initiated a procedure on March 3rd of updating families daily on school days as to our response and the current state of the outbreak. In coordination with the Maine CDC and our school physician, Dr. Charles De Sieyes, we began to implement multiple measures to combat the possible spread of this disease in our school and community. On March 13th the decision was made to close the school building and to start a remote learning program, which began on March 16th. The school will continue that remote learning program for the remainder of the 2019-20 school year. Below you can find an archive of our daily email updates as well as links to emails and documents relevant to remote learning.

a.strong: To sign up for our email list, click this link.

p.a: Flex Friday End of Year Plan

div.p: Week 25 - Remote Learning Starts Monday - Weekly Friday Email that went over a lot of how remote learning would be implemented.

p.a: Social Distancing: This is Not a Snow Day
Maine Schools Providing Meals to Students During Closures
Supporting Teenagers and Young Adults During the Coronavirus Crisis

p.em: Our students are joining teacher Jonathan Amory’s emergency engineering effort to ease the state’s ventilator shortage. Read more about that below.

p.em: For more information, visit the Maine CDC's page about COVID-19

br.br: The Maine CDC and 211 Maine have a service for Mainers to get answers to questions about COVID-19 at any time. This service is available by dialing 211 (or 1-866-811-5695), texting your ZIP code to 898-211, or emailing

p.em: . Calls, texts, and emails to 211 are answered 24/7 by a person here in the state.

div.p: Please report any issues with this page or these emails to operations@baxter-academy.org
